text:
My 10yo boy attended 3-day ‚ÄúThe Monsters vs Robots‚Äù lego robotics coding camp (10am-3pm daily) at WondersWork recently. He enjoyed himself very much, making the robots from lego parts and programming them to battle other classmates‚Äô robots.
Teacher Enzo was very nice, helping to adjust the wires when my boy got them wrong, thanks Teacher Enzo!
Lunches were not bad.
Other than Teacher, there was 1 assistant to help with the class of total 5 children.
All in all, 3 days well-spent and we look forward to signing up for the next holiday camp!

My child attended 3 days Pokemon Spin Battle Challenge Lego Robotics Coding Camp and enjoyed it very much. He enjoyed the robotic concept taught and learning together with other children. Highly recommending this place for children to learning coding/Robotics.

My kids have fun during the workshop. Trainer very engaging with children and makes the workshop interesting. Meals provided also suitable for my kids üòä Overall a good and interesting experience for my kids during the holidays üëç

My daughter, 8 year old, attended 3 day Pok√©mon camp and enjoyed herself immensely, being a beginner in coding. Teachers were patient and it‚Äôs useful for cultivating an introduction to coding and trying the unknown
Very responsible teacher and interesting program . My son love it and he has continued his program for 3 years.
